intro: Lotononis montana, commonly known as the mountain lotononis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation interest.
